PageTitle: peer advertise add-path path-number(BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view)
FuncDef:
The peer advertise add-path path-number command sets the number of preferred routes to be advertised to a specified peer.
The undo peer advertise add-path command restores the default configurations. The peer advertise add-path path-number command sets the number of preferred routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The undo peer advertise add-path command restores the default configurations. By default, BGP advertises only one optimal route to its peer.
ParentView: BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view,BGP view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the maximum number of routes that the device can send to a peer.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 64.

Specifies the name of a route-policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-bgp] peer 172.16.1.1 advertise add-path path-number 3 route-policy test-policy
ExtraInfo: After BGP Add-Path is configured on an RR, the RR needs to send BGP Add-Path routes to a specified BGP peer. To configure the maximum number of routes that the RR can send to a specified BGP peer, run the peer advertise add-path path-number command. The actual number of preferred routes advertised to the peer is the smaller value between the number of routes configured using the peer advertise add-path path-number command and the number of selected routes. If the number of routes that the RR can send to the peer is less than the actual number of routes selected by the RR, the RR selects routes based on the BGP route selection rules.
